# defersCurrentPageDisplay

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that controls when the current page is displayed.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var defersCurrentPageDisplay: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

Set the value of this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] so that, when the user taps the control to go to a new page, the class defers updating the page control until it calls [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPageControl/updateCurrentPageDisplay()]. Set the value to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] (the default) to have the page control updated immediately.

## Managing pages

- **currentPage**: The current page, shown by the page control as a white dot.
- **numberOfPages**: The number of pages the receiver shows (as dots).
- **hidesForSinglePage**: A Boolean value that controls whether the page control is hidden when there is only one page.
- **updateCurrentPageDisplay()**: Updates the page indicator to the current page.
